course.title: The Historical Origins of Middle Eastern Development
course.description: Middle Eastern countries enjoyed world economic leadership during the Middle Ages, and continue to play an important role in the world economy. This course will explore the historical development of Middle Eastern economies. Topics include the effects of colonialism, natural resource endowments and religion on economic growth. The course will emphasize how these and other historical factors continue to influence development prospects in the region today.
course.notes: A research paper is required. This course meets the concentration writing requirement.
